Wait, let me double-check. Rows after Sony include other vendors like NEC, MSI, etc. Looking at row 24: Storage is "hdd". No DVD there.

19. MSI X370 - same
20. MSI S30 - hdd + ssd

So in the entire table, only Sony's subnotebooks list DVD as an option. All other vendors either have SSD, HDD, or combinations without mentioning DVDs.

Therefore, the claim is TRUE because Sony is the only vendor offering DVD in their subnotebooks.
